key_points.text:
PARAMOUNT AND TKO ANNOUNCE HISTORIC UFC MEDIA RIGHTS AGREEMENT
Positive Sentiment:
Analysts at Schaeffer’s Research flagged a ripe environment for a short squeeze on TKO shares following the UFC rights deal, as high short interest could amplify gains.
TKO Group Stock Ripe for Short Squeeze After UFC

Positive Sentiment:
TKO struck a seven-year, $7.7 billion U.S. media-rights agreement with Paramount (NASDAQ:PSKY), securing $1.1 billion in annual revenue beginning 2026 and moving UFC events off pay-per-view onto Paramount+ for all numbered events and Fight Nights.

Roth Capital Issues Negative Estimate for TKO Group Earnings
Negative Sentiment:
Seaport Research Partners lowered its Q4 2025 EPS projection for TKO to a ($0.33) loss (from ($0.08)), reflecting a more cautious view on the company’s financials ahead of its new streaming model.

Seaport Research Partners raised its Q3 2025 EPS estimate for TKO to $0.48 (from $0.37), suggesting stronger-than-expected pre-deal operating performance.
MarketBeat Analyst Report
Neutral Sentiment:
Roth Capital cut its Q3 2025 EPS forecast for TKO to $0.22 (from $0.27) and trimmed Q4 estimates, signaling concerns over the company’s near‐term margin outlook.
